results.name: Triangle read by rows, coefficients of the generalized Eulerian polynomials A_{n, 3}(x) in descending order.
comment: The row sums equal the triple factorial numbers A032031 and the alternating row sums, i.e., Sum_{k=0..n}(-1)^k*T(n,k), are up to a sign A000810. - _Johannes W. Meijer_, May 04 2013
formula: Generating function of the polynomials is gf(n, k) = k^n*n!*(1/x-1)^(n+1)[t^n](x*e^(t*x/k)*(1-x*e(t*x))^(-1)) for k = 3; here [t^n]f(t,x) is the coefficient of t^n in f(t,x).

The row polynomials R(n, x) = Sum_{k=0..n} T(n, k)*x^k are R(n, x) = (x-1)^n*Sum_{m=0} A284861(n, m)*(1/(x-1))^m, n >= 0, i.e. the row polynomials of A284861 in the variable 1/(x-1) multiplied by (x-1)^n.
The row polynomials with falling powers are P(n, x) = (1-x)^n*Sum_{m=0..n} A284861(n, m)*(x/(1-x))^m, n >= 0.
The e.g.f. of the row polynomials in falling powers of x (A_{n, 3}(x) of the name) is exp((1-x)*z)/(1 - (x/(1 - x)) * (exp(3*(1-x)*z) - 1)) = (1-x)*exp((1-x)*z)/(1 - x*exp(3*(1-x)*z)).
The e.g.f. of the row polynomials R(n, x) (rising powers of x) is then (1-x)*exp(2*(1-x)*z)/(1 - x*exp(3*(1-x)*z)).
Three term recurrence: T(n, k) = 0 if n < k , T(n, -1) = 0, T(0,0) = 1, T(n, k) = (3*(n-k)+1)*T(n-1, k-1) + (3*k+2)*T(n-1, k) for n >= 1, k=0..n. (End)
example: Three term recurrence: T(2,1) = (3*(2-1)+1)*2 + (3*1+2)*1 = 13. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Apr 10 2017
maple: gf := proc(n, k) local f; f := (x,t) -> x*exp(t*x/k)/(1-x*exp(t*x));

mathematica: gf[n_, k_] := Module[{f, s}, f[x_, t_] := x*Exp[t*x/k]/(1-x*Exp[t*x]); s = Series[f[x, t], {t, 0, n+2}]; ((1-x)/x)^(n+1)*k^n*n!*SeriesCoefficient[s, {t, 0, n}]]; Table[Table[SeriesCoefficient[gf[n, 3], {x, 0, n-k}], {k, 0, n}], {n, 0, 8}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 27 2014, after Maple *)
program: def EB(n, k, x):  # Modified cardinal B-splines
if n == 1: return 0 if (x < 0) or (x >= 1) else 1
return k*x*EB(n-1, k, x) + k*(n-x)*EB(n-1, k, x-1)
def EulerianPolynomial(n, k): # Generalized Eulerian polynomials
return add(EB(n+1, k, m+1/k)*x^m for m in (0..n))
(PARI) T(n, k) = sum(j=0, n - k, (-1)^(n - k - j)*binomial(n + 1, n - k - j)*(1 + 3*j)^n);
for(n=0, 10, for(k=0, n, print1(T(n, k),", ");); print();) \\ _Indranil Ghosh_, Apr 10 2017
def T(n,k): return sum((-1)**(n - k - j)* binomial(n + 1, n - k - j)*(1 + 3*j)**n for j in range(n - k + 1))
for n in range(11): print([T(n, k) for k in range(n + 1)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Apr 10 2017
